properties.name: Kindhearted Society (Crazygames sdk demo)
properties.description: A demo of the various functionalities developed for CrazyGames games.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CrazyGamesAdApi
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allow games to be hosted on CrazyGames website and display ads.
description: Please refer to [CrazyGames' guide](https://docs.crazygames.com/sdk/html5-v2/intro/) to know when to call the different actions.
- 1.3.0: The SDK have to be manually called via an action.

eventsFunctions.description: Return an invite link.
eventsFunctions.name: InviteLink

eventsFunctions.description: Display an invite button.
eventsFunctions.name: InviteButton
eventsFunctions.sentence: Display an invite button for the room id: _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Load CrazyGames SDK.
eventsFunctions.name: LoadSDK

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the CrazyGames SDK is ready to be used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsSDKLoaded

eventsFunctions.description: Let CrazyGames know gameplay started.
eventsFunctions.name: SetGameplayStarted

eventsFunctions.description: Let CrazyGames know gameplay stopped.
eventsFunctions.name: SetGameplayStoped

eventsFunctions.description: Let CrazyGames know loading started.
eventsFunctions.name: SetLoadingStarted

eventsFunctions.description: Let CrazyGames know loading stopped.
eventsFunctions.name: SetLoadingStopped

eventsFunctions.description: Display a video ad. The game is automatically muted while the video is playing.
eventsFunctions.name: DisplayCrazyGamesAd

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if a video ad just finished playing successfully.
eventsFunctions.name: AdFinishedPlaying

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if a video ad is playing.
eventsFunctions.name: IsVideoAdPlaying

eventsFunctions.description: Check if Ad had an error.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if Ad had an error
eventsFunctions.name: AdHadAnError

eventsFunctions.description: Generate an invite link to invite friends to join your game sessions. This URL can be added to the clipboard or displayed in the game to let the user select it.
eventsFunctions.name: GenerateInviteLink

eventsFunctions.description: Display an happy time by emitting sparkling confetti. The celebration should remain a special moment.
eventsFunctions.name: DisplayHappyTime

eventsFunctions.description: Scan for adblockers.
eventsFunctions.name: ScanForAdBlockers

eventsFunctions.description: Check if user is using an ad blocker. This condition is always false before the "Scan for adblockers" is called.
eventsFunctions.name: IsAdBlocked

eventsFunctions.description: Display a banner that can be called once per 60 seconds.
eventsFunctions.name: DisplayBanner
eventsFunctions.sentence: Display a banner: _PARAM1_ at position _PARAM3_ ; _PARAM4_ with size _PARAM2_

inlineCode: // Create a container for the banner if needed
div.setAttribute("style", "pointer-events: none; position:fixed; z-index:1; width: " + size.width + "px; height: " + size.height + "px;left:" + positionX + "px; top:" + positionY + "px;");
// Insert the new container in first position in the body
// x, y coordinates are from the top left of the screen
// Result is always undefined when requesting banners
logger.log("End request banner", result === undefined ? "Requesting banners" : result);

eventsFunctions.description: Hide a banner.
eventsFunctions.name: HideBanner

eventsFunctions.description: Hide all banners.
eventsFunctions.name: HideAllBanners

eventsFunctions.description: Hide the invite button.
eventsFunctions.name: HideInviteButton

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh, @arthuro555
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Clipboard
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: This extension allows to access the clipboard.

eventsFunctions.description:
Read the text from the clipboard asynchronously. 

Note also that on web browsers, the user might be asked for permissions to read from the clipboard.
eventsFunctions.name: AsynchronouslyReadTextCrossPlaform
eventsFunctions.sentence: Read clipboard and store text in _PARAM1_

inlineCode: const logger = this.logger || (this.logger = new gdjs.Logger("Clipboard extension"));
logger.error("An error occured while getting clipboard content: ", error);
logger.error("An error occured while getting clipboard content: ", error.message);
logger.error("Unable to read from the clipboard: no method found for this platform.");

parameters.description: Callback variable where to store the clipboard contents
parameters.name: callback

eventsFunctions.description: Write the text in the clipboard.
eventsFunctions.name: WriteText

inlineCode: else console.error("Unable to write to the clipboard: no method found for this platform.");

eventsFunctions.description:
Read the text from the clipboard asynchronously. As this is "asynchronous", the variable won't be immediately filled with the text from the clipboard. You will have to wait a few frames before it will be. If you want your subsequent actions and subevents to automatically wait for the read to finish, use the waiting version of this action instead (recomended). 

Note also that on web browsers, the user might be asked for permissions to read from the clipboard.
eventsFunctions.fullName: (No waiting) Get text from the clipboard
eventsFunctions.name: ReadTextCrossPlaform
eventsFunctions.sentence: Read clipboard and store text in _PARAM1_

inlineCode: console.error("Error occured while getting clipboard content: ", err.message)
} else console.error("Unable to read from the clipboard: no method found for this platform.")

parameters.description: Callback variable where to store the result
parameters.name: callback

eventsFunctions.description: [DEPRECATED] Read the text from the clipboard (Windows, macOS, Linux only)
eventsFunctions.fullName: [DEPRECATED] Get text from the clipboard (Windows, macOS, Linux)
eventsFunctions.name: ReadText

events.comment: This is here for retrocompatibility. Try to use the AsynchronouslyReadTextCrossPlatform action instead.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetState

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

Add additional behaviors to make juicy buttons with animated responses to user input:
